hypothesis_content.title: Intraday Mean Reversion on 1H Volume-Weighted Extreme
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL or BULL regimes, when BTC's price on a 1-hour chart moves 2.5% away from its Volume-Weighted Average Price (VWAP) calculated from the daily open, it will revert to within 1% of the VWAP within the next 6 hours, provided the move was not accompanied by a 1.5x surge in volume relative to the 20-hour average.
hypothesis_content.rationale: VWAP is a key benchmark for intraday traders. Moves beyond 2.5% on low volume are often 'air pockets' lacking conviction, prompting algorithmic and institutional flows to fade the move and re-align with the volume-weighted mean.
entry_conditions: Volume on the 1H candle of the move < 1.5 * 20H volume average
Entry at close of the 1H candle that breaches the 2.5% threshold

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to within 1% of the daily VWAP
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves an additional 1.5% away from VWAP

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such signals see price continue moving away from VWAP by another 1.5% before reverting to the 1% band.
